headline: Trump to exempt automakers from certain tariffs: FT
summary: The Financial Times is reporting that President Trump is planning to exempt US automakers from tariffs on auto parts from China. Asking for a Trend Host Julie Hyman and Roundhill Investments CEO Dave Mazza discuss the report. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: General Motors and Ford shares rise following FT report on tariff exemptions
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of General Motors (NYSE: NYSE:GM) and Ford Motor (NYSE: NYSE:F) climbed 4% and 3% respectively, following a report from the Financial Times that President Donald Trump plans to exempt carmakers from certain tariffs on China imports. The automotive giants saw an uptick in their stock value as the market responded to the Trump administration’s decision to spare the industry from some of the more burdensome tariffs, particularly those on car parts imported from China.

The automotive giants saw an uptick in their stock value as the market responded to the Trump administration’s decision to spare the industry from some of the more burdensome tariffs, particularly those on car parts imported from China.

headline: Conduent Recognized as General Motors’ 2024 Supplier of the Year
summary: FLORHAM PARK, N.J., April 23, 2025--Conduent Incorporated (Nasdaq: CNDT) has been named a 2024 Supplier of the Year by General Motors at GM’s 33rd annual Supplier of the Year event.
